Latent spaces have both continuous and discrete properties

Last updated on May 1, 2021

Latent spaces can be considered to house both continuous and discrete operators. For instance, (continuous) distance is a proxy for semantic similarity. In contrast, constellations of embeddings with their unique topology are discrete arrangements.

Resources

  • https://youtu.be/J0p_thJJnoo?t=2659
